@RomanJoySays @RepRitchie Bottom line: there are legal limits to what the federal government can do to states because states, unlike territories (colonies), have rights.

@RomanJoySays @RepRitchie There is even a limit to the conditions that the federal government can attach to federal funds given to states. In one of the ACA cases, the Supreme Court struck down the required Medicaid expansion as “unconstitutionally coercive.”

@RomanJoySays @RepRitchie It would be unconstitutional for the federal government to impose a financial control board on a state, which has sovereignty under the US Constitution. By contrast, territories have no sovereignty and therefore can be colonized at the hands of the federal government.
